Comfort.comm: The accommodations are described as comfortable, spacious, and relaxing.

cont.itemA: We always stay in the 2-bedroom condos; it's such a relaxing, roomy place to stay.
cont.itemB: We had plenty of room and were very comfortable; the pull-out couch was of excellent quality.

Cleanliness.comm: The properties are noted for being clean.

cont.itemA: The condo was very clean and the staff very friendly.
cont.itemB: The condo was clean and comfortable.

Location.comm: The hotel is in a beautiful and peaceful area, which is away from the hustle of the main strip.

cont.itemA: Great location on the lake, wonderful staff and nice, clean condos.
cont.itemB: It's about 10 minutes past the main strip of Branson activities but it's worth the drive for the gorgeous views and lovely relaxing hotel.

itemA.Price: I had some concerns about value for my money, but it was money well spent.
itemA.Quality: Our unit was tastefully decorated and well maintained.
itemA.Dining: The ice cream shop packed up banana splits for us to take to our room.
itemA.View: The view was beautiful; our unit faced the lake and we enjoyed having coffee on the large covered patio.
itemA.Amenities: The nature trails, pools, game room, hot tub and private dock sweeten the deal.
itemA.Service: To our surprise, check in was easy even though we arrived late at night.

itemB.Quality: For the price and service level of the hotel, I did expect to have a mini fridge; however, our room type did not have one.
itemB.Dining: The food was expensive; the cafe restaurant had the best food.
itemB.Service: Overall not a very welcoming feeling at the Chateau; the doormen were unpleasant and wouldn't smile.
itemB.Design: My wife and I loved the rustic lodge look nestled amongst the trees.
